verses.verse: Moreover Job <S%H347><s%> continued <S%H3254><s%> his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
Oh that I were as in months <S%H3391><s%> past, <S%H6924><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> when God <S%H433><s%> preserved <S%H8104><s%> me;
When his candle <S%H5216><s%> shined <S%H1984><s%> on my head, <S%H7218><s%> and when by his light <S%H216><s%> I walked <S%H3212><s%> through darkness; <S%H2822><s%>
As I was in the days <S%H3117><s%> of my youth, <S%H2779><s%> when the secret <S%H5475><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> was on my tabernacle; <S%H168><s%>
When <S%H5750><s%> the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> was yet <S%H5750><s%> with me, when my children <S%H5288><s%> were about <S%H5439><s%> me;
When I washed <S%H7364><s%> my steps <S%H1978><s%> with butter, <S%H2529><s%> and the rock <S%H6697><s%> poured <S%H6694><s%> me out rivers <S%H6388><s%> of oil; <S%H8081><s%>
When I went <S%H3318><s%> out to the gate <S%H8179><s%> through <S%H5921><s%> the city, <S%H7176><s%> when I prepared <S%H3559><s%> my seat <S%H4186><s%> in the street! <S%H7339><s%>
The young <S%H5288><s%> men saw <S%H7200><s%> me, and hid <S%H2244><s%> themselves: and the aged <S%H2205><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> and stood <S%H5975><s%> up.
The princes <S%H8269><s%> refrained <S%H6113><s%> talking, <S%H4405><s%> and laid <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3709><s%> on their mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
The nobles <S%H5057><s%> held <S%H2244><s%> their peace, <S%H6963><s%> and their tongue <S%H3956><s%> stuck <S%H1692><s%> to the roof <S%H2441><s%> of their mouth. <S%H2441><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> the ear <S%H241><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> me, then it blessed <S%H833><s%> me; and when the eye <S%H5869><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> me, it gave witness <S%H5749><s%> to me:
Because <S%H3588><s%> I delivered <S%H4422><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> that cried, <S%H7768><s%> and the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and him that had none <S%H3808><s%> to help <S%H5826><s%> him.
The blessing <S%H1293><s%> of him that was ready to perish <S%H6><s%> came <S%H935><s%> on me: and I caused the widow's <S%H490><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> to sing <S%H7442><s%> for joy. <S%H7442><s%>
I put <S%H3847><s%> on righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> and it clothed <S%H3847><s%> me: my judgment <S%H4941><s%> was as a robe <S%H4598><s%> and a diadem. <S%H6797><s%>
I was eyes <S%H5869><s%> to the blind, <S%H5787><s%> and feet <S%H7272><s%> was I to the lame. <S%H6455><s%>
I was a father <S%H1><s%> to the poor: <S%H34><s%> and the cause <S%H7379><s%> which I knew <S%H3045><s%> not I searched <S%H2713><s%> out.
And I broke <S%H7665><s%> the jaws <S%H4973><s%> of the wicked, <S%H5767><s%> and plucked <S%H7993><s%> the spoil <S%H2964><s%> out of his teeth. <S%H8127><s%>
Then I said, <S%H559><s%> I shall die <S%H1478><s%> in my nest, <S%H7064><s%> and I shall multiply <S%H7235><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> as the sand. <S%H2344><s%>
My root <S%H8328><s%> was spread <S%H6605><s%> out by the waters, <S%H4325><s%> and the dew <S%H2919><s%> lay <S%H3885><s%> all <S%H3885><s%> night on my branch. <S%H7105><s%>
My glory <S%H3519><s%> was fresh <S%H2319><s%> in me, and my bow <S%H7198><s%> was renewed <S%H2498><s%> in my hand. <S%H3027><s%>
To me men gave ear, <S%H8085><s%> and waited, <S%H3176><s%> and kept silence <S%H1826><s%> at <S%H3926><s%> my counsel. <S%H6098><s%>
After <S%H310><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> they spoke not again; <S%H8138><s%> and my speech <S%H4405><s%> dropped <S%H5197><s%> on them.
And they waited <S%H3176><s%> for me as for the rain; <S%H4306><s%> and they opened <S%H6473><s%> their mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide as for the latter <S%H4456><s%> rain. <S%H4456><s%>
If I laughed <S%H7832><s%> on <S%H413><s%> them, they believed <S%H539><s%> it not; and the light <S%H216><s%> of my countenance <S%H6440><s%> they cast <S%H5307><s%> not down. <S%H5307><s%>

I chose <S%H977><s%> out their way, <S%H1870><s%> and sat <S%H3427><s%> chief, <S%H7218><s%> and dwelled <S%H7931><s%> as a king <S%H4428><s%> in the army, <S%H1416><s%> as one that comforts <S%H5162><s%> the mourners. <S%H57><s%>
